label: Asana
description: Arcade tools designed for LLMs to interact with Asana

tools.name: AttachFileToTask
tools.description:
Attaches a file to an Asana task

Provide exactly one of file_content_str, file_content_base64, or file_content_url, never more
than one.

- Use file_content_str for text files (will be encoded using file_encoding)
- Use file_content_base64 for binary files like images, PDFs, etc.
- Use file_content_url if the file is hosted on an external URL

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task to attach the file to.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: The name of the file to attach with format extension. E.g. 'Image.png' or 'Report.pdf'.

parameters.name: file_content_str
parameters.description: The string contents of the file to attach. Use this if the file is a text file. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: file_content_base64
parameters.description: The base64-encoded binary contents of the file. Use this for binary files like images or PDFs. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: file_content_url
parameters.description: The URL of the file to attach. Use this if the file is hosted on an external URL. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: file_encoding
parameters.description: The encoding of the file to attach. Only used with file_content_str. Defaults to 'utf-8'.

output.description: The task with the file attached.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the tag to create. Length must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the tag to create. Defaults to None (no description).

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the tag to create. Defaults to None (no color).

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to create the tag in. If not provided, it will associated the tag to a current workspace, if there's only one. Otherwise, it will raise an error.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateTask
tools.description:
Creates a task in Asana

The task must be associated to at least one of the following: parent_task_id, project, or
workspace_id. If none of these are provided and the account has only one workspace, the task
will be associated to that workspace. If the account has multiple workspaces, an error will
be raised with a list of available workspaces.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the task

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date of the task in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The due date of the task in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the task. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: parent_task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent task. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to associate the task to. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The ID or name of the project to associate the task to. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to assign the task to. Defaults to 'me', which assigns the task to the current user.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the task. Multiple tags can be provided in the list. Each item in the list can be a tag name (e.g. 'My Tag') or a tag ID (e.g. '1234567890'). If a tag name does not exist, it will be automatically created with the new task. Defaults to None (no tags associated).

description.value: Create a new design for the homepage with updated branding.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTaskById
tools.description: Get a task by its ID

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task to get.

parameters.name: max_subtasks
parameters.description: The maximum number of subtasks to return. Min of 0 (no subtasks), max of 100. Defaults to 100.

output.description: The task with the given ID.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for tasks. Matches against the task name and description.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to search for tasks. Defaults to None. If not provided and the user has only one workspace, it will use that workspace. If not provided and the user has multiple workspaces, it will raise an error listing the available workspaces.

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to filter tasks assigned to. Defaults to None (does not filter by assignee).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The ID or name of the project to filter tasks. Defaults to None (searches tasks associated to any project or no project).

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Restricts the search to tasks associated to the given team ID. Defaults to None (searches tasks associated to any team).

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Restricts the search to tasks associated to the given tags. Each item in the list can be a tag name (e.g. 'My Tag') or a tag ID (e.g. '1234567890'). Defaults to None (searches tasks associated to any tag or no tag).

parameters.name: due_on
parameters.description: Match tasks that are due exactly on this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (searches tasks due on any date or without a due date).

parameters.name: due_on_or_after
parameters.description: Match tasks that are due on OR AFTER this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01' Defaults to None (searches tasks due on any date or without a due date).

parameters.name: due_on_or_before
parameters.description: Match tasks that are due on OR BEFORE this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01' Defaults to None (searches tasks due on any date or without a due date).

parameters.name: start_on
parameters.description: Match tasks that started on this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (searches tasks started on any date or without a start date).

parameters.name: start_on_or_after
parameters.description: Match tasks that started on OR AFTER this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01' Defaults to None (searches tasks started on any date or without a start date).

parameters.name: start_on_or_before
parameters.description: Match tasks that started on OR BEFORE this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01' Defaults to None (searches tasks started on any date or without a start date).

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Match tasks that are completed. Defaults to None (does not filter by completion status).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of tasks to return. Min of 1, max of 100. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The field to sort the tasks by. Defaults to TaskSortBy.MODIFIED_AT.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The order to sort the tasks by. Defaults to SortOrder.DESCENDING.

output.description: The tasks that match the query.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The team ID to get projects from. Defaults to None (does not filter by team).

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to get projects from. Defaults to None. If not provided and the user has only one workspace, it will use that workspace. If not provided and the user has multiple workspaces, it will raise an error listing the available workspaces.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of teams to return. Min is 1, max is 100. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next page of teams. Defaults to None (start from the first page of teams)

parameters.name: next_page_token

tools.name: MarkTaskAsCompleted
tools.description: Mark a task in Asana as completed

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task to mark as completed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task to update.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name of the task. Defaults to None (does not change the current name).

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: The new completion status of the task. Provide True to mark the task as completed, False to mark it as not completed. Defaults to None (does not change the current completion status).

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The new start date of the task in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (does not change the current start date).

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The new due date of the task in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (does not change the current due date).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The new description of the task. Defaults to None (does not change the current description).

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the new user to assign the task to. Provide 'me' to assign the task to the current user. Defaults to None (does not change the current assignee).

description.value: This is an updated description for the task.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

documentationChunks.content: The Arcade Asana MCP Server uses the [Asana auth provider](/references/auth-providers/asana) to connect to users' Asana accounts.

summary:
Arcade offers a toolkit for seamless interaction with Asana, enabling developers to automate project management tasks. The toolkit supports various functionalities tailored for managing tasks, tags, and projects efficiently.

**Capabilities**
- Create, update, and manage tasks and subtasks within Asana.
- Attach files to tasks in various formats.
- Retrieve detailed information about projects, teams, and users.
- List and create tags for organized task management.
- Mark tasks as completed to streamline workflows.

**OAuth**
- **Provider**: Asana
- **Scopes**: default

**Secrets**
- No secret types are utilized in this toolkit.
